name: uspgrunop
params: class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, wff w0

stmt.origin: upgrunop(c0, c1, c2, c3, c4, w0)
stmt.pretty: upgrunop(c0, c1, c2, c3, c4, w0)

body.origin:
|- wi(w0, wcel(cop(c0, cun(c1, c2)), cupgr))
-| wi(w0, wcel(c3, cupgr))
-| wi(w0, wcel(c4, cupgr))
-| wceq(c1, cfv(ciedg, c3))
-| wceq(c2, cfv(ciedg, c4))
-| wceq(c0, cfv(cvtx, c3))
-| wi(w0, wceq(cfv(cvtx, c4), c0))
-| wi(w0, wceq(cin(cdm(c1), cdm(c2)), emptycls))
body.pretty:
⊢ (w0 → < c0,(c1 ⋃ c2)> ∈ UPGraph)
⊣ (w0 → c3 ∈ UPGraph)
⊣ (w0 → c4 ∈ UPGraph)
⊣ c1 =(iEdg ` c3)
⊣ c2 =(iEdg ` c4)
⊣ c0 =(Vtx ` c3)
⊣ (w0 →(Vtx ` c4)= c0)
⊣ (w0 →(dom(c1)⋂ dom(c2))= ∅)

-| wceq(c2, cfv(ciedg, c4))

-| wi(w0, wceq(cfv(cvtx, c4), c0))
-| wi(w0, wceq(cin(cdm(c1), cdm(c2)), emptycls))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (w0 → < c0,(c1 ⋃ c2)> ∈ UPGraph)
⊣ (w0 → c3 ∈ UPGraph)
⊣ (w0 → c4 ∈ UPGraph)
⊣ c1 =(iEdg ` c3)
⊣ c2 =(iEdg ` c4)
⊣ c0 =(Vtx ` c3)
⊣ (w0 →(Vtx ` c4)= c0)
⊣ (w0 →(dom(c1)⋂ dom(c2))= ∅)

body.origin:
|- wi(w0, wcel(c3, cupgr))
-| wi(w0, wcel(c3, cuspgr))
-| wi(wcel(c3, cuspgr), wcel(c3, cupgr))
body.pretty:
⊢ (w0 → c3 ∈ UPGraph)
⊣ (w0 → c3 ∈ USPGraph)
⊣ (c3 ∈ USPGraph → c3 ∈ UPGraph)

comment: The union of two simple pseudographs (with the same vertex set): If ` <. V , E >. ` and ` <. V , F >. ` are simple pseudographs, then ` <. V , E u. F >. ` is a pseudograph (the vertex set stays the same, but the edges from both graphs are kept, maybe resulting incident two edges between two vertices). (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 10-Aug-2017.) (Revised by AV, 16-Oct-2020.) (Revised by AV, 24-Oct-2021.)
